mdRecord.dcterms:title: Old Tomb at Mt. Vernon
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, N. G. (Newton G.)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of the old tomb at Mount Vernon with two unidentified men. Mounted on orange board. The photographer's imprint on the stereograph mount reads, N. G. Johnson, Photographer, 426 7th St., Washington D. C. Only Authorized Publisher of Mount Vernon Views. The reverse of the stereograph has an adhered printed label - Old Tomb at Mt. Vernon, In which Washington's remains were first placed, and from which they were removed in 1831 to the New Tomb, which was built according to directions in Washington's will, and where they now lie. N. G. Johnson, Photographer, 426 7th St., Washington, D. C.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799--Old tomb
